newsitem.title: USA: PHP Healthcare in $73 mln deal with N.J. HIP.
newsitem.headline: PHP Healthcare in $73 mln deal with N.J. HIP.

text.p: PHP Healthcare Corp said Wedenesday that it has paid $73 million to run the facilities of The Health Insurance Plan of New Jersey (HIP) until the year 2007.

Under terms of the 20-year deal, PHP said it will acquire the assets of HIP's 18 healthcare centers and its pharmacy and optical services, which will be integrated into PHP's Pinnacle Health Enterprises unit.
PHP also said it will run the healthcare services for HIP's 200,000 members through a global capitation and exclusive arrangement.
HIP will monitor the quality of patient care and be responsible for the development of new healthcare programs and new member recruitment.

Anthony Watson, HIP's chairman, said in a statement, "This strategic alliance is part of HIP's corporate mission to reorganize our healthcare delivery system to meet the revolutionary, accelerating changes taking place in the highly competitive healthcare market.
It also represents a logical next step for HIP in our continuing mission to solidify our dominant position in the region's managed care industry."
The not-for-profit HIP Health Plan of New Jersey is part of the 1.2 million member HIP system with affiliates in New York, Pennsylvania, and Florida.

"This alliance will greatly enhance health care in New Jersey, benefiting members of both the HIP and Pinnacle Health Enterprises networks," said PHP chief executive Jack Mazur in a statement. "The future of health care is in developing collaborative working relationships between providers, physicians and payors. I believe the flexibility of our network models and the quality care we provide has led to our success, and that in turn, will build shareholder value."
PHP, a for-profit corporation founded in 1975, currently manages more than 90 healthcare projects in 28 markets.
